text.content:
NURSING NOTE 
    0700 - 1900
 
    Has there been a FALL in the past 48 hours? 
         No
 
P: Infection
I: Abx as ordered
E: Afebrile
 
PROBLEM LIST AND GOALS
~~~~ 
PAIN
~~~~
      PROBLEM or Need:  PAIN (Pain scale > 4, or patient requests 
intervention)
Goal: Pain scale scale < 4, or patient reports acceptable pain level.
Target date: Within 72 hours of admission. 
 
                 Problem status:  COMPLETED
IV ACCESS
   Peripheral IV 
     Size:20#
     Location:R Hand 
     Date placed:May 30,2012
 
0700 report from night shift.  Assessment completed.  pt is afebrile.  Flank 
pain improved.  Awaiting lab results.  Pt sitting up in chair eating 
breakfast.  Denies nausea/vomiting.
 
0745 Patient ambulated in hallway, independant, stable on feet.  Walked to 
shower, independant with morning ADLs.
 
0820 MD at bedside.  Discused plan of care with patient. 
 
0940 pt ambulated to shower indipendantly
 
1200 pt sitting in chair to eat lunch, after a few bites felt nauseated.  
Small emesis at approx 1215.  Notified Dr. Provider.  Pt given one dose 
of Zofran with good relief.  Pt is now sipping water.
 
1300 pt remains afebrile
 
1410 pt is ambulting independantly around the unit
 
1730 pt tolerating dinner with no nausea or vomiting.  Ate about 50%.
 
1900 Report to night shift RN
text.author: NURSE,TWENTY-SIX
